meanings.definition: A line extending from an observer's eye to a point of interest.
meanings.sent1: The sightlines from the audience to the stage were clear and unobstructed.
meanings.sent2: In the theater, good sightlines ensure everyone can see the actors clearly.
meanings.sent3: The sightlines at the concert were so good, even the back row felt like they were in the front!
meanings.sent4: Her gaze followed the sightlines of the mountains, reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sightlines of the painting drew the viewer's attention to the focal point.

meanings.definition: The lines of vision in a performance space.
meanings.sent1: The sightlines in the auditorium allowed every seat to have a great view of the stage.
meanings.sent2: Actors need to be aware of the sightlines to ensure they are visible to the entire audience.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke played with the sightlines, making the audience look in unexpected directions.
meanings.sent4: The sightlines of the play intertwined, creating a visual masterpiece on stage.
meanings.sent5: The director adjusted the set to improve the sightlines for the audience's viewing pleasure.

meanings.definition: The lines along which an observer can see.
meanings.sent1: The sightlines in the museum guided visitors through the exhibits seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: Architects carefully consider the sightlines in a building to enhance the overall experience.
meanings.sent3: The sightlines in the maze tricked the participants into thinking dead-ends were the way out.
meanings.sent4: His words cut through the room, creating sightlines of understanding among the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The sightlines of the city skyline were breathtaking from the top of the tower.
